title: Telephone area code for Hawaii
description: Area code  808 is a telephone area code in the North American Numbering Plan (NANP) for the Hawaiian Islands, comprising the windward and the leeward islands. The area code also serves Wake Island in the western Pacific Ocean. The code was assigned on August  8,  1957, about two years before the statehood of Hawaii.
history: The  808 area code, or "Hawaii", was assigned on August  8,  1957, about two years before the statehood of Hawaii.
population: Over 1.4 million people live in Hawaii.
dialingProcedure: Despite the state's rapid growth, and the proliferation of mobile numbers, a single area code is projected to be enough to serve the state until at least the third quarter of  2035.
nationalSuicidePreventionLifeline: In  2020,  988 was designated as a nationwide three-digit dialing code for the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline. This created a conflict for Hawaii's exchanges, all of which permitted seven-digit dialing. Therefore, area code  808 transitioned to ten-digit dialing on October  24,  2021.
specialFaceMask: Marcus Mariota, quarterback for the Las Vegas Raiders football team and  2014 Heisman Trophy winner, had a special face mask honoring the  808 area code while playing with the University of Oregon.
scamming: The 808 area code is sometimes used by telephone scammers with the intent of confusing the receiver of the call into thinking that it is an  800 area code due to their similar appearance.
seeAlso: List of North American Numbering Plan area codes
references: North American Numbering Plan Administrator (NANPA) (October  2021). October  2021 NPA Exhaust Analysis, viewed  18 November  2021.
Transition to  10-digit dialing (for  988 as  3-digit access to National Suicide Prevention Hotline)
Scammers use Hawaii area code to get you to pick up the phone
